meanings.definition: The state or quality of being reticent.
meanings.sent1: Her retinenes in social situations often made others think she was shy.
meanings.sent2: His retinenes in sharing personal information made him a mysterious figure.
meanings.sent3: Despite his retinenes, he still managed to make friends easily.
meanings.sent4: The retinenes of the old house gave it an air of secrecy and intrigue.
meanings.sent5: The retinenes of the forest at night was broken only by the occasional rustle of leaves.

meanings.definition: The act of being reserved or not revealing one's thoughts or feelings readily.
meanings.sent1: She showed her retinenes by keeping her emotions hidden behind a smile.
meanings.sent2: His retinenes in discussions often left others wondering what he truly thought.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's retinenes on stage led to an awkward but funny silence.
meanings.sent4: The retinenes of the closed book hinted at a story waiting to be discovered.
meanings.sent5: The retinenes of the painting left viewers to interpret its meaning on their own.

meanings.definition: The tendency to be silent or uncommunicative.
meanings.sent1: His retinenes in group settings often made him the quietest person in the room.
meanings.sent2: The retinenes of the library was only broken by the sound of pages turning.
meanings.sent3: The cat's retinenes after being scolded was a clear sign of guilt.
meanings.sent4: The retinenes of the desert at noon was almost eerie in its stillness.
meanings.sent5: The retinenes of the classroom during the test was palpable as everyone focused on their work.
